intro: Hieracium sterzingense, commonly known as the Sterzing hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaves that are typically alternate and basal. The plant features yellow to orange composite flowers, which are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a rough, hairy texture, and it often grows in rocky or grassy habitats at high altitudes. Hieracium sterzingense is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh, mountainous environments.
